q: Al-Jazeera is crucial because so many households in the Middle East turn to it in times of turmoil, said Dana Shell Smith, deputy assistant secretary for international media engagement, an office created last summer. If we are not in the conversation, people will be speaking for us or about us, said Shell Smith, who speaks Arabic. "We need to make sure we are out there speaking for ourselves." Eric Schmidt , 55, has no doubt Page is ready for the challenges ahead. "Larry has been with me in every major decision in the past decade," Eric Schmidt said in an interview Thursday. It's not like he has been sitting around doing nothing. Wedbush Morgan analyst Lou Kerner says, "Facebook is the most ominous threat to Google Inc. , but Facebook is just emblematic of the rising pace at which all of these( startups) are moving. It's

called Microsoft," he said. "Microsoft has more cash, more engineers, more global reach. We see competition from Microsoft every day." He then went on to point out that Facebook has clearly stated they don't want to get into the search business. Facebook users tend to use Google search. Facebook's ads business does not displace our advertising. I'm somewhat perplexed by the obsession because I don't think the facts support it. Things are going great for Google. As an aside, Eric Schmidt 's assertion about Facebook users searching via Google is a strange assertion, given that Zuckerberg's site has a pretty cosy relationship with Microsoft's Bing. "The X Factor" is planning on changing the reality show singing game- they have also expanded the age pool to younger and older contestants- something executive producer Simon Cowell is looking forward to seeing. I like the idea that a 12-year-old on this show can compete with an older singer and a singing group, Simon Cowell said in a statement issued by FOX. He has seen only a few minutes of this season's "American Idol" and its reconstituted panel with Steven Tyler , Jennifer Lopez and Randy Jackson, he said.

Philadelphia lost three of four games with Allen Iverson sidelined. Having Allen Iverson back helps. He's a finisher. He can get to the line and get the ball to guy at the right time. We've missed that, Elton Brand said. "Hacking into people's phones is illegal," she said. â¢ Tony Blair never had a mobile while prime minister Obviously the criminal law has got to be complied with and if it is broken then it should be investigated by the police and it should be enforced. Nobody is above the law, no newspaper editor, no journalist. Scotland Yard has declined to respond to the latest allegations. Mr Andy Coulson has denied knowledge of any hacking, but stepped down on Friday over the continuing media coverage of the issue.
